00030 #ifndef SC_REPORT_HANDLER_H
00031 #define SC_REPORT_HANDLER_H
00032 
00033 namespace sc_core {
00034 
00035 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00036 //  STRUCT : sc_msg_def
00037 //
00038 //  Exception message definition structure
00039 // ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
00040 
00041 struct SC_API sc_msg_def
00042 {
00043     const char*  msg_type;
00044     sc_actions   actions;
00045     sc_actions   sev_actions[SC_MAX_SEVERITY];
00046     unsigned     limit;
00047     unsigned     sev_limit[SC_MAX_SEVERITY];
00048     unsigned     limit_mask; // 0 - limit, 1..4 - sev_limit
00049     unsigned     call_count;
00050     unsigned     sev_call_count[SC_MAX_SEVERITY];
00051     char*        msg_type_data;
00052 
00053     int          id; // backward compatibility with 2.0+
00054 };
00055 
00056 typedef void (* sc_report_handler_proc)(const sc_report&, const sc_actions &);
00057 class sc_report;
00058 extern SC_API bool sc_report_close_default_log();
00059 class SC_API sc_report_handler
00060 {
00061 public:
00062     static void report(sc_severity,
00063                        const char* msg_type,
00064                        const char* msg,
00065                        const char* file,
00066                        int line);
00067 
00068     static void report( sc_severity, 
00069                         const char* msg_type, 
00070                         const char* msg, 
00071                         int verbosity, 
00072                         const char* file, 
00073                         int line );
00074 
00075     static sc_actions set_actions(sc_severity,
00076                                   sc_actions = SC_UNSPECIFIED);
00077 
00078     static sc_actions set_actions(const char * msg_type,
00079                                   sc_actions = SC_UNSPECIFIED);
00080 
00081     static sc_actions set_actions(const char * msg_type,
00082                                   sc_severity,
00083                                   sc_actions = SC_UNSPECIFIED);
00084 
00085     static int stop_after(sc_severity, int limit = -1);
00086     static int stop_after(const char* msg_type, int limit = -1);
00087     static int stop_after(const char* msg_type, sc_severity, int limit = -1);
00088 
00089     static sc_actions suppress(sc_actions);
00090     static sc_actions suppress();
00091     static sc_actions force(sc_actions);
00092     static sc_actions force();
00093 
00094     static int get_count(sc_severity severity_);
00095     static int get_count(const char* msg_type_);
00096     static int get_count(const char* msg_type_, sc_severity severity_);
00097 
00098     static int get_verbosity_level();
00099     static int set_verbosity_level( int level );
00100 
00101 
00102     static void initialize(); // just reset counters
00103     static void release(); // initialize() needed for reports after it
00104 
00105     static sc_report_handler_proc set_handler(sc_report_handler_proc);
00106     static sc_report_handler_proc get_handler();
00107     // use set_handler(NULL); to restore default handler
00108     static void default_handler(const sc_report&, const sc_actions&);
00109 
00110     static sc_actions get_new_action_id();
00111 
00112     static sc_report* get_cached_report();
00113     static void clear_cached_report();
00114 
00115     // if filename is NULL, the previous log file name will be removed.
00116     // The provider of a report_handler supposed to handle this.
00117     // Return false if filename is not NULL and filename is already set.
00118     static bool set_log_file_name(const char* filename);
00119     static const char* get_log_file_name();
00120 
00121     // how the implementation should handle caught (sc_report) exceptions
00122     static sc_actions set_catch_actions(sc_actions);
00123     static sc_actions get_catch_actions();
00124 
00125 public: // private, actually
00126 
00127     struct msg_def_items
00128     {
00129         sc_msg_def*     md;        // have to point to sc_msg_def-s
00130         int             count;     // set to number of items in md[]
00131         bool            allocated; // used internally, previous value ignored
00132         msg_def_items*  next;      // used internally, previous value ignored
00133     };
00134 
00135     static void add_static_msg_types(msg_def_items *);
00136     static sc_msg_def* add_msg_type(const char * msg_type);
00137 
00138 protected:
00139 
00140     static void cache_report(const sc_report&);
00141     static sc_actions execute(sc_msg_def*, sc_severity);
00142 
00143     static sc_actions   suppress_mask;
00144     static sc_actions   force_mask;
00145     static sc_actions   sev_actions[SC_MAX_SEVERITY];
00146     static unsigned     sev_limit[SC_MAX_SEVERITY];
00147     static unsigned     sev_call_count[SC_MAX_SEVERITY];
00148     static sc_report*   last_global_report;
00149     static sc_actions   available_actions;
00150     static sc_actions   catch_actions;
00151     static char*        log_file_name;
00152     static int          verbosity_level;
00153 
00154     static msg_def_items*  messages;
00155     static msg_def_items   msg_terminator;
00156 
00157     static sc_report_handler_proc  handler;
00158 
00159     static sc_msg_def* mdlookup(const char* msg_type);
00160 
00161 private: // backward compatibility with 2.0+
00162 
00163     friend class sc_report;
00164     static sc_msg_def* mdlookup(int id);
00165 
00166 public:
00167 
00168     static void report(sc_severity,
00169                        int         id,
00170                        const char* add_msg,
00171                        const char* file,
00172                        int         line);
